clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Vitamin A With and Without Zinc and Multivitamin Supplementation on Malaria Morbidity in Ghanaian Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Vitamin A With and Without Zinc and Multivitamin Supplementation on Malaria Morbidity in Ghanaian Children

collaborator.agency: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine the effect of combining vitamin A (VA), zinc (Z) and multivitamins (MV- A, B1, B2, B6, B12, C, D and E) on malaria morbidity

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 542 children aged between 6-59 months received either: (i) VA (control) or (ii) VA & Z (VAZ) or (iii) VA, Z & MV (VAZM). VA was delivered as a single dose while MV and Z were delivered daily. Malaria cases were managed by community health workers, who used rapid diagnostic test to confirm infection prior to treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every month up to six months
primary_outcome.description: While taking the supplement, malaria incidence will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every month up to six months
secondary_outcome.description: While taking the supplement, diarrhea incidence will be measured

arm_group.description: A single dose of 20,000IU Vitamin A for the whole study period
A single dose of 20,000IU Vitamin A and 10mg of elemental zinc each day for 5 months
A single dose of 20,000IU Vitamin A , 10mg of elemental zinc each day and 0.5ml/kg multivitamin syrup for 5 months

intervention.description: Combination of vitamin A and zinc supplements
Combination of vitamin A, zinc and multivitamins

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- under 5years
- will stay in the community for 10years
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic diseases
